The Lost Citadel of the Scarlet Minotaur.name: The Lost Citadel of the Scarlet Minotaur
The Lost Citadel of the Scarlet Minotaur.description: Long ago, a mighty enclave of warriors lived inside the Lost Citadel. They worshipped bulls in ever-bloodier, cultish rituals that culminated in their leader, Minoros, transforming into the Scarlet Minotaur. This immortal avatar of rage slaughtered the warriors in a single night of mayhem. However, some of their servants escaped through the unseen halls used by the lowly. These beastmen hid in the fallen citadel, trapped by superstitious fear of the outside.
The Lost Citadel of the Scarlet Minotaur.caption: A 1st-3rd-level adventure for Shadowdark RPG

b4peWtS82m3su5q1.name: Roll Random Beastmen NPC

oYUJG4g7naduZNeb.name: Roll Random Ettercap NPC

uQOjVmE0co1U8yws.name: The Lost Citadel: Random Encounter Check

l251PEOpGq6Ss7Z9.name: The Lost Citadel: Random Encounter Check

Area 1-27.name: Area 1-27
Area 1-27.text:
Danger Level. Risky. Check for an encounter every 2 crawling rounds or after the PCs make loud noises (1d6, 1 = encounter).

Light. Total darkness unless noted. All denizens are dark-adapted.

Doors. Stone. 1:6 chance of being stuck shut. Unlocked unless noted.

NPCs. See @UUID[.ji9paT4DbaYTmMPm]{pg. 64} for beastmen and ettercap NPC generators.

The Scarlet Minotaur. Each time you roll on the Random Encounters table after the first, apply a cumulative -2 to the result (treat results below 1 as 1). Reset this count each time an encounter with the Scarlet Minotaur occurs.

@UUID[Macro.uQOjVmE0co1U8yws]{The Lost Citadel: Random Encounter Check}

Rumors

d8

Details

1

The @UUID[Actor.XPNU79kJyse04pL3]{Scarlet Minotaur} (Area 18) stalks into sight, bellowing challenges and pawing the stone

2

[[/r 1d4]] @UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.fcgq7uwsJEMMdRNx]{ettercaps} and [[/r 1d8]] @UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.k8tAgECWIzPIStGU]{beastmen} clash in a bloody melee

3

A dry gust of wind extinguishes all torches and lamps

4

[[/r 1d6]] @UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.fcgq7uwsJEMMdRNx]{ettercaps} creep along, searching for gold and gems

5

The @UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.cWzG0yEVgIk8ijk6]{skeletons} of [[/r 1d6]] dead adventurers or warrior-mages stagger into sight

6

[[/r 2d4]] @UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.k8tAgECWIzPIStGU]{beastmen} argue in hushed whispers over who gets to eat the centipedes they just trapped in a bag

7

[[/r 1d4]] @UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.0JAEN5FsKjaXXZaA]{darkmantles} swoop out, bobbing and spinning in a territorial warning dance

8

A @UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.j7sQ6Km2jSx5twCC]{cave creeper} rushes along the ceiling toward light

Room 1: Mural Chamber.name: Room 1: Mural Chamber
Room 1: Mural Chamber.text:
Walls: Floor-to-ceiling murals painted in vibrant jewel tones. Red Pillars: Tapered, banded in black marble at top and bottom.

  • Murals. People in white robes kneeling in a room of red pillars before a colossal, onyx bull with horns lowered.

    • Hidden Niche. Behind bull statue. @UUID[Item.r893z0hIf4LSdPs3]{Silver-Inlaid Bull Horn} (30 gp).

  • Ettercap NPC. Eska (weaselly, disloyal). Just hid a stolen pearl in Area 2. Hides on the northeast corner of ceiling. Screeches an alarm and flees toward Area 4 if attacked.

    • Escapes. Three ettercaps from Area 4 set an ambush in Area 2.

Room 2: Blinding Cave.name: Room 2: Blinding Cave
Room 2: Blinding Cave.text:
Walls: Flecked with countless, smooth shards of quartz. White Bundles: Man-sized, several stuffed into cave corners.

  • Ettercap Ambush. If Eska in Area 1 raised alarm, three hostile @UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.Actor.fcgq7uwsJEMMdRNx]{ettercaps} from Area 4 cling to 20' ceiling.

  • Walls. Dazzlingly reflective. [[request 12 dex]] when entering with bright light or blinded for [[/r 1d4]] rounds (ettercaps are unaffected).

    • Prying. Carefully extracted piece of cave wall serves as a mirror.

  • White Bundles. Five @UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.k8tAgECWIzPIStGU]{beastmen} wrapped in ettercap silk. 1:6 chance one still lives. @UUID[Item.7unKOF9uy9ECqkEy]{Pearl} (40 gp) hidden inside one's mouth.

Room 3: Web-Choked Cave.name: Room 3: Web-Choked Cave
Room 3: Web-Choked Cave.text:
Walls and Floor: Covered in thick, gauzy sheets of webbing.

  • Webs. Sticky. [[request 12 str]] to break free and move each turn. Highly flammable ([[/r 1d6]] damage to stuck creatures, burns [[/r 1d4]] rounds).

    • Rolled Parchment. Stuck in webs, 10' up.@UUID[Item.Jo88wNZQdCtvuuuS]{Scroll of Hold Portal} .

  • Secret Tunnel. Hidden by a wall of webs. Ettercaps reseal it each time they pass through.

    • Chittering. Listeners hear shrill, tittering whispers from Area 4.

Room 4: Ettercap Nest.name: Room 4: Ettercap Nest
Room 4: Ettercap Nest.text:
Creatures: Group of purple-furred, potbellied humanoids with spindly legs. Snarling at each other about a missing pearl. Cave: Cramped, tufts of spiderweb everywhere. Floor: Neat piles of gold and lustrous objects. Ceiling: Low (10'), three narrow shafts (1').

  • @UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.fcgq7uwsJEMMdRNx]{Ettercaps.} Five. Three go to Area 2 if @UUID[Actor.QvVJAySJZMTMnEZp]{Eska} (Area 1) raises an alarm. Might parlay, but are fatally treasure-crazed. Squeeze through ceiling shafts with scoops of each other's loot if outclassed.

    • NPCs. @UUID[Actor.1WXEDbF6gSa4fQUQ]{Skir} (animated, loud), @UUID[Actor.rok3i6Gy0RjoBgrq]{Yisha} (tiny, sinister), @UUID[Actor.82lFpkXeVpKnPWCQ]{Grisk} (old, irritable), @UUID[Actor.eVuNGaceV93M5whd]{Uliss} (lumbering, dull), @UUID[Actor.rh1ZgUTuHcwhlt4F]{Chee} (silver fur, elegant).

  • Treasure. 12 evenly-valued piles (some belong to wanderers). Eska (Area 1) stole a pearl from Grisk's share and hid it in Area 2.

    Details.

    • 200 gp,

    • 2 x @UUID[Item.WKk0GVD1KHrI6fav]{pearls} (40 gp each)

    • @UUID[Item.TggK5foyVW9RXoHw]{alabaster statuette of a bull} (20 gp),

    • 2 x @UUID[Item.BjWjRaMBbsv50AjU]{silver incense bowl}s (15 gp each),

    • @UUID[Item.U3dML6TSDUKJXBUh]{jade snake bracelet} (20 gp),

    • @UUID[Item.iW6GTpg33QYMca8k]{necklace of thick gold links} (30 gp).

Room 5: Robing Chamber.name: Room 5: Robing Chamber
Room 5: Robing Chamber.text:
Skeleton: Pinned to wall. Hands clasp a spear jutting from ribcage.

Walls: Chipped mosaic of cavorting dolphins. White robes on pegs.

  • Skeleton. Wears decaying, crimson-dyed leather armor. Bronze shortsword hangs from belt.

    • Spear. Driven deep into stone with inhuman force. Bronze tip.

  • Robes. Four. Musty, rotten. Bronze key to Area 21 in one's pocket.

Room 6: Bathhouse.name: Room 6: Bathhouse
Room 6: Bathhouse.text:
Statue: A life-sized, snake-haired woman with arms raised and mouth open in a scream. Stone Basins: Smooth, human-sized.

  • Statue. Turning the hinged arms down causes scalding water to spew from mouth ([[request 12 dex]] to leap aside or [[/r 1d4]] damage).

  • Basins. Six. Coiling snake carvings. Stone plugs wedged in drains.

    • Removing Plugs. Cumulative 1:6 to unleash a @UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.U9moCUg8DnL6C0Sq]{scarab swarm}.

Room 7: Bull Statue.name: Room 7: Bull Statue
Room 7: Bull Statue.text:
Bull Statue: Towering (10'), bronze. Horns lowered for a charge. Hall: 15' high. Pairs of deep holes punched into wall opposite statue.

  • Statue. Motion-activated. 3:6 chance/round it animates and charges to end of hall (ignores Scarlet Minotaur). [[request 15 dex]] or [[/r 2d6]] damage and knocked flat. Trots back to position and resets.

    • @UUID[Item.ToSK7skdC9OPzmwZ]{Emerald.} (120 gp), embedded in statue's forehead. Shattering (AC 20, 1 HP) deactivates statue but reduces gem's value to 20 gp (@UUID[Item.hiVLFYBR666Zm29e]{Emerald (Shattered)}).

Room 8: Blood Bowls.name: Room 8: Blood Bowls
Room 8: Blood Bowls.text:
Alcoves: Square, black plinths each hold a simple terracotta bowl.

  • Bowls. Six. Stamped with a seal that shows a warrior kneeling in a black rain, arms and mouth open to the sky.

    • Blood. Filling a bowl with fresh blood charges the blood with healing magic ([[/r 1d4]] HP, must drink). Once used, bowl crumbles.

Room 9: Sorcerous Pillars.name: Room 9: Sorcerous Pillars
Room 9: Sorcerous Pillars.text:
Pillars: Four pairs, painted rich jewel tones. Capped in black marble.

Body: Purple, spindly humanoid lies facedown halfway across room.

Greatsword: Bronze, brightly polished. Blade is sunken into a black marble altar beyond the pillars.

  • Pillars. Moving past each pair activates their effect. Returning past the pair ends it. In order, from north to south:

    • Red. Anything flammable on you ignites. [[/r 1d4]] damage/round.

    • Blue. Sea water fills your lungs. You drown in [[/r 1d6]] rounds.

    • Green. Poisoned. [[request 12 con]] on your turn or lose turn.

    • Purple. You go blind and move at half speed.

  • Body. Ettercap. Scorched fur. Mouth and chest matted with salt rime. Claw marks around eyes.

  • Greatsword. [[request 12 str]] to remove from altar. +1 greatsword called @UUID[Item.JpRmSUeNd7qwnXZa]{Asterion}. A creature cannot move the wielder against their will.

Room 10: Bull Statue.name: Room 10: Bull Statue
Room 10: Bull Statue.text:
• Bull Statue. As Area 7. Skeleton stuck on horns covers emerald.

    • @UUID[Item.ToSK7skdC9OPzmwZ]{Emerald.} (120 gp), embedded in statue's forehead. Shattering (AC 20, 1 HP) deactivates statue but reduces gem's value to 20 gp (@UUID[Item.hiVLFYBR666Zm29e]{Emerald (Shattered)}).

Room 11: Prison.name: Room 11: Prison
Room 11: Prison.text:
Door: Hefty stone slab with keyhole. Cold and damp to the touch.

  • Door. Unlocked, barricaded from inside. [[request 18 str]] to force.

    • Listening. Faint metallic, clinking sound on other side.

    • Keyhole. Darkness with a few points of bobbing, red light.

  • Inside. Four @UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.cWzG0yEVgIk8ijk6]{skeletons} in tattered, red leather armor shuffle around, knocking into manacles anchored to floor. Four bronze-shod spears braced through handle (broken if door opened).

    • Walls. Scratched in ancient Common: "Days since the Beast appeared." About 40 tally lines below it, gradually fainter.

Room 12: Armory.name: Room 12: Armory
Room 12: Armory.text:
Floor: Tangled heaps of gaping skeletons. Walls: A bronze dagger sticks in the stone by its point. Alcoves: Splintered, wooden racks.

  • @UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.cWzG0yEVgIk8ijk6]{Skeletons}. Twelve. Several are cut completely in half. Tatters of red-dyed armor, shattered shields, and bronze shortswords.

    • If Touched. Cumulative 1:12 chance one rises as @UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.ZCbay6SPPzbbz2bJ]{wight} (once only). Otherwise, skeleton nearly rises, but collapses into dust.

    • Treasure. The wight wears a gold @UUID[Item.O98T6HjIZ9nrajO4]{Scarab of Protection}.

  • Racks. Red shield with black bull painted on it, three spears.

  • Walls. Scorch marks and scratches. Deep, sweeping gouges at chest and head height.

  • @UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.k8tAgECWIzPIStGU]{Beastmen}. Three listen from Area 14. If PCs are noisy/destructive, adjust their attitudes one step toward hostile.

Room 13: Bull Statue.name: Room 13: Bull Statue
Room 13: Bull Statue.text: • Bull Statue. As Area 7. 40 gp scattered at statue's feet.

Room 14: Hidden Hall.name: Room 14: Hidden Hall
Room 14: Hidden Hall.text:
Hall: Silent and narrow. Stale, dead air. Smell: Urine and body odor, eye-watering. Floor: Scattered with rat bones and centipede husks.

  • @UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.k8tAgECWIzPIStGU]{Beastmen}. Three. Ragged, grey fur. Each stands by one of the doors, listening. They regroup in Area 14 if PCs enter. If PCs are noisy, adjust their attitude one step toward hostile.

    • NPCs. @UUID[Actor.mdRstp355OUOyY7r]{Haruut} (stocky, mistrustful), @UUID[Actor.VIiW9qercPbgheGh]{Grall} (young, timid), @UUID[Actor.PZ6Pt3fz7LRaEWqU]{Chops} (long jowls, blustery). They speak in harsh whispers and cringe at loud sounds.

  • Secret Doors. All visible from this side.

Room 15: Jar Storage.name: Room 15: Jar Storage
Room 15: Jar Storage.text:
Terracotta Jars: Clustered in corners. Fat and rounded, various heights. Air: Sulfuric scent. Sound: Occasional faint squeak and hiss. South Door: White, jagged lines gouged into the stone.

  • Jars. 20 jars sealed with cork and wax. Stamped with images of people carving wheat with scythes. Sticky, black mush inside.

    • Explosive. Shaking/striking jar causes it to shatter from sulfuric gas buildup. [[request 12 dex]] or 1d4 damage. Possible chain reaction.

    • Treasure. Cumulative 1:20 chance of finding an @UUID[Item.R9rWEWg4biAMlj0U]{ivory egg} shot with grey veins inside one (40 gp). It's actually a cockatrice egg.

  • South Door. Carving in Common: "R.I.P. Orwyn the Younger."

Room 16: Offering Bowls.name: Room 16: Offering Bowls
Room 16: Offering Bowls.text:
Halls: A weighty, stone bowl in each. Chest-high. Murals: Rows of peasants pour jars of gold coins and wheat into massive, grey bowls. Imperious, red-armored warriors with bronze spears supervise.

  • Stone Bowls. Smooth and worn. Placing food or gold inside grants a Luck Token (once per character).

  • Human NPC. Giuseppe Baldini, N herbalist (crotchety, middle- aged, poor). Wants treasure. Hides behind southeast bowl.

Room 17: Broken Bull Statue.name: Room 17: Broken Bull Statue
Room 17: Broken Bull Statue.text:
Bull Statue: Towering (10'), bronze. Head and horns smashed deeply into cracked wall. Body: Pinned between wall and bull head.

  • Statue. No longer functions. @UUID[Item.vykb09m5y4gCdVIS]{Shattered emerald} (20 gp) embedded in forehead.

  • Body. Young, human man in chainmail and helm. Carries @UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.gear.1T8oUkfkBtYTLNF3]{bastard sword} and shield (splintered). Dark green cloak.

    • Backpack. @UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.gear.z3xc7HGysC4ZCU8e]{Torch}, @UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.gear.EPndk3DPOEOSvbga]{10 pitons}, @UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.gear.6ZRwVHFlh5QiyZWC]{60' rope}, withered apple, and a @UUID[Item.VO8hdwr2ulhRwwW0]{silver locket} with a painting of a smiling, red-haired woman (5 gp).

Room 18: Central Courtyard.name: Room 18: Central Courtyard
Room 18: Central Courtyard.text:
Bull Statue: 20' tall, black onyx, rippling muscle. Horns lowered and dotted with white objects. Courtyard: Sandy flagstones, sun- scorched. Heaps of bleached bones. Red Pillars: Free-standing, some shattered and crumbling. Cast cool, dark shadows.

  • @UUID[Actor.XPNU79kJyse04pL3]{The Scarlet Minotaur}. 3:6 chance of being present. If not, cumulative 1:6 chance per round it returns. @UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.c3Nvj86e0Layz3NG]{Minotaur}: 9' tall, wine- red fur. Charges at shadows, headbutts pillars, snorts and bellows. Two-headed, bronze +1 greataxe called @UUID[Item.gtfx2i7YimBMi2bo]{Bloodlust}; wielder deals x4 damage on a critical hit.

  • Bull Statue. 30 humanoid skulls in various states of rot punched onto horns like necklace beads. Some have traces of grey fur.

    • Ritual Sacrifice. Punching a freshly beheaded humanoid skull onto a horn grants +1 point of Strength. Each additional time: cumulative 1:4 chance of transforming into a beastman.

  • Bones. Trampled and crushed. No skulls. Piles of dented armor and broken weapons, both steel and bronze.

  • Treasure. Each round spent sifting reveals one of the following:

  1. @UUID[Item.yv6v0HqiSsnAGOHC]{Scarred mithral shield} carved with prowling tiger (40 gp)

  2. Bag of 60 gp stamped with long-dead emperor

  3. @UUID[Item.qQfrScSGMEBGHCFZ]{Scroll of Burning Hands} in bronze tube adorned with jade dragons (80 gp)

  4. @UUID[Item.0HvhZP8EOXqyT3p2]{Silvered longsword} with half-moon pommel (30 gp).

Room 19: Bas-Relief Hall.name: Room 19: Bas-Relief Hall
Room 19: Bas-Relief Hall.text:
Creature: Gangly, gray-furred humanoid sprawled on the ground facedown. Lumpy burlap sack near hand. Walls: Bas-relief carvings dense with human figures and scenes.

  • @UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.k8tAgECWIzPIStGU]{Beastman} NPC. @UUID[Actor.XbO8sDu1ToDVVoh9]{Brell} (frail, panicky). Fell and cracked his head fleeing from a sound. Wakes up in [[/r 1d4]] rounds.

    • Traits. Scorned younger brother of beastmen leader, @UUID[Actor.bERcM50HvKw0ZY6o]{Rogath} (Area 23). Naively loyal. Hopes to earn his brother's affection.

    • Burlap Sack. Two dead rats, necks snapped. A gift for Rogath.

  • Carvings. Scenes of acrobats leaping over charging bulls and warriors fighting in ritualistic combat.

    • Hidden Niche. Behind a bull-leaper. @UUID[Item.a69T3oP2oVH2yqMn]{Silver, horned helm} (15 gp).

Room 20: Mosaic Room.name: Room 20: Mosaic Room
Room 20: Mosaic Room.text:
Floor: Mosaic of rich orange, yellow, and red tiles in a swirl pattern.

  • Mosaic. Pattern camouflages a mottled @UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.QErMaMVIbddgk9MX]{ochre jelly}. 3:6 chance of stepping on it without careful inspection.

Room 21: Throne Chamber.name: Room 21: Throne Chamber
Room 21: Throne Chamber.text:
Door: Bronze, emblazoned with sun and projecting rays. Locked.

  • Door. Key is in Area 5. Each failed attempt to open without key causes door to glow hot. Cumulative 1:6 chance it shoots three random rays of fire ([[/r d20+4]]{+4 attack}, [[/r 2d6]] damage each).

  • Inside. Bronze throne with skeleton (not undead) impaled by a golden spear. Red pillars with script in ancient Common.

    • Skeleton. Sits on throne (50 gp, two gear slots). Wears a gold diadem with a pearl (60 gp). Hands clasped around +1 spear called @UUID[Item.cY0UIbpokdT448Pw]{Vigilant}. Its wielder cannot be surprised.

    • Pillars. Lists of tributes paid to the Bull God, Oros, by the Warrior-Kings. Damanthus the Brave gave gold, Sarpen the Wise gave wheat, and Minoros the Cruel gave blood.

Room 22: Labyrinth.name: Room 22: Labyrinth
Room 22: Labyrinth.text:
Halls: Narrow, 20' tall, shadowy at top. Tight corners. Hot wind rushes through. Floor: Skirls of sand blown in from outside.

  • Sand. Fading, cloven hoofprints. Two handspans wide each.

    • Dead-Ends. Clusters of gourd-sized, terracotta jars. Various earth tones and shapes. Most are smashed.

    • Intact Jars. [[/r 1d6]] per dead-end. Each has [[/r 1d4]] gp, handful of ash, and pinkie-sized, human doll of colorful thread. Taking anything: 1:20 chance of ghost haunting on next full moon.

Room 23: Beastmen Lair.name: Room 23: Beastmen Lair
Room 23: Beastmen Lair.text:
Creatures: 15 hunched, grey-furred humanoids chewing on centipedes and speaking in harsh whispers. One lounges on a mat of rat pelts, picking his teeth. Room: Grimy, cramped, scattered with rodent bones. Smell: Unwashed bodies, urine.

  • @UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.k8tAgECWIzPIStGU]{Beastmen}. Hostile toward noise-makers. Superstitious about the (non-existent) dragons that wait outside the citadel to eat them.

    • NPCs. @UUID[Actor.bERcM50HvKw0ZY6o]{Rogath} (hulking, lazy, feared leader). Minions: @UUID[Actor.CDxRc2pIwG7SK73E]{Grenton} (wiry, mistrustful), @UUID[Actor.L91uEF4duAo8T5Eq]{Hargol} (eyes point in different directions, agrees to everything), @UUID[Actor.4Ou1RViS2GnqvRh9]{Beetle} (scuttles, elaborate plan-maker).

    • Alliance. Rogath wants Scarlet Minotaur dead so he can be king of the citadel. Cheerfully sends his hated brother, @UUID[Actor.XbO8sDu1ToDVVoh9]{Brell} (Area 19), and his non-minions into danger to help this effort.

  • Secret Doors. All visible from this side. A beastman guards each.

Room 24: Lookout Room.name: Room 24: Lookout Room
Room 24: Lookout Room.text:
Creatures: Two shaggy, stooped humanoids listen sullenly at doors. Room: Filthy, low ceiling. Stench: Wet animal and dung.

  • NPCs. @UUID[Actor.hoL50RSbMvRNrrcY]{Irvog} (young, earnest), @UUID[Actor.Fg9DEqSk8eACtwOw]{Blort} (scarred face, disciplined). If PCs are noisy, adjust their attitude one step toward hostile.

  • Secret Doors. All visible from this side.

Room 25: Training Chamber.name: Room 25: Training Chamber
Room 25: Training Chamber.text:
Armor Stands: Five suits of red-dyed leather reinforced with bronze studs. Weapon Rack: Bronze weapons covered in a rime of dust. Walls: Countless chips and nicks.

  • Armor. Touching armor or taking a weapon off rack causes three suits to spring to life (@UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.monsters.qSeHWgP59WltutCz]{animated armor}) and attack for [[/r 1d4]] rounds.

  • Weapon Rack. Five @UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.gear.KQTWQwznjK80gVEU]{shortswords}, @UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.gear.ZPUhNMmwXXrtbCXi]{longswords}, @UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.gear.UWp4WkkiaBMSXYPE]{shields}, and @UUID[Compendium.shadowdark.gear.brIFMH0sOVmqX02N]{spears}.

Room 26: Hall of Kings.name: Room 26: Hall of Kings
Room 26: Hall of Kings.text:
Alcoves: Bronze, lifelike statue of a man on a raised pedestal in each.

  • Statues. Athletic, proud, similar facial features. Draped in robes, wearing @UUID[Item.xTOy6PVB5iu1asFa]{diadems} with pearls (40 gp each). Each holds a weapon.

  • Inscriptions. In ancient Common. Damanthus, Son of Aster ([[/r 1d12]]{greatsword}), Sarpen, Son of Damanthus ([[/r 1d6]]{spear}), Minoros, Son of Sarpen ([[/r 1d10]]{greataxe}).

  • Diadems. Trapped. Touching the pearl causes the statue to swing its weapon ([[/r 1d20+5]]{+5 attack}).

Room 27: Sacrifice Cave.name: Sala 27: Caverna do Sacrifício
Room 27: Sacrifice Cave.text:
Caverna: Fria e úmida, com teto alto (9 m). Estalactites pingando. Poço: Água carmesim, turva e parada. Cheiro: Odor metálico de cobre.

  • Espíritos. Dezenas de sombras humanas e esfumaçadas tremeluzem nas bordas da escuridão. Se a luz se apagar, elas descem com gritos fantasmagóricos, causando [[/r 1d8]] de dano por rodada em cada personagem.

  • Poço. 6 m de profundidade. Água amaldiçoada turvada por sangue. [[request 12 con]] para cada rodada de contato ou o personagem perde temporariamente 1 ponto de Sabedoria (recupera após descanso). Se chegar a 0 de Sabedoria, torna-se catatônico permanentemente.

    • No Fundo. Um cemitério de dezenas de esqueletos humanos e de touros. Entre eles há 200 po, uma @UUID[Item.i3gSIEVGxXhlUkdn]{Varinha de Cegar/Ensurdecer}, três @UUID[Item.cFi2Wtbwz3qkiJMx]{estatuetas de touro em ônix} (15 po cada), @UUID[Item.ip1i9MpeJeyf7ayu]{Botas do Gato} e um pequeno frasco que abriga a alma de um poderoso feiticeiro chamado Malfune.

Overview.name: Visão Geral
Overview.text:
Chave das Salas

As descrições destacadas no início de cada local são seguras para compartilhar com os jogadores. Os detalhes em tópicos abaixo são para o Mestre.

Antecedentes

Há muito tempo, um poderoso enclave de guerreiros vivia dentro da Cidadela Perdida. Eles veneravam touros em rituais cultistas cada vez mais sangrentos que culminaram em seu líder, Minoros, transformando-se no Minotauro Escarlate. Este avatar imortal da fúria massacrou os guerreiros em uma única noite de devastação. No entanto, alguns de seus servos escaparam pelos corredores ocultos usados pelos mais humildes. Esses homens-fera esconderam-se na cidadela em ruínas, presos pelo medo supersticioso do mundo exterior.

Facções

Homens-Fera. Esses seres de pelo acinzentado e ferozes evitam o Minotauro Escarlate há gerações. Habitam a Área 23, acreditando que dragões esperam do lado de fora para devorar qualquer um que deixe a cidadela. O medo incessante os tornou cruéis e covardes. Seu líder, Rogath, governa pela força de suas garras.

Ettercaps. Recentemente, um grupo de ettercaps rastejou para a Área 4 a partir das cavernas sob a cidadela. Eles se esgueiram pelos corredores assombrados pelo minotauro, atraídos por gemas e ouro esquecidos. Planejam partir "assim que tivermos butim suficiente", um momento que nunca parece chegar. São desorganizados e unânimes em sua ganância.

O Minotauro Escarlate. Imenso, vermelho como sangue, bufando e espumando. Ele percorre os corredores labirínticos da Cidadela Perdida em busca de criaturas para abater. Retorna à Área 18 entre patrulhas.

@UUID[RollTable.iFdrtN3kJk5yth9S]{A Cidadela Perdida: Boatos}

Boatos

1

Antigos reis que habitaram a cidadela possuíam armas mágicas temidas em todo o mundo.

2

Um minotauro selvagem, encharcado de sangue, ronda os salões da cidadela.

3

Pilhas de gemas e ouro jazem espalhadas como se totalmente esquecidas.

4

Cuidado ao tocar o corpo de um antigo habitante da cidadela.

5

Homens-fera oportunistas e de pelo acinzentado espreitam nas sombras.

6

A cidadela está repleta de salas e passagens secretas.

Arredores e Entradas da Cidadela Perdida

A Cidadela. Cigarras zumbem na vegetação árida ao redor da cidadela. Blocos arenosos e colunas vermelho-coral sustentam seus telhados escalonados (9 a 12 m de altura, planos). O interior fechado é um labirinto fresco e escuro de câmaras abobadadas e corredores que convergem para um pátio central.

  • Portas Sudeste. Para a Área 1. Esculpidas com touros saltando em meio ao ar.

  • Corredor Nordeste. Uma porta estilhaçada diante de uma escada para a Área 10.

  • Corredor Sudoeste. Um túnel aberto que leva ao labirinto, Área 22.

  • Pátio. Área 18, a céu aberto. Escaladores podem alcançá-lo pelo telhado.

Ordem de Batalha

Homens-Fera. Recuam para a Área 14 ou 23, evitando a Área 18. Conhecem a localização de todas as portas secretas. Conduzem inimigos para armadilhas de estátuas de touro. Não deixam seus esconderijos para ajudar outros. Aterrorizados por ruídos altos.

Ettercaps. Movem-se pelos tetos, evitando estátuas de touros. Não conhecem portas secretas. Recuam para a Área 4 e atacam em grupo para ajudar aliados. São facilmente distraídos por tesouros. Relutam em entrar na Área 18.

O Minotauro Escarlate. Persegue suas presas sem nunca recuar. Não conhece portas secretas. Esquece inimigos fora de vista em 1d6 rodadas. Retorna à Área 18 pelo menos uma vez por hora.
